intro: Calycobolus gilgianus, commonly known as the Gilgian suncup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are typically clustered in a single head, giving it a sun-like appearance. Calycobolus gilgianus thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
